distributions.c

00001 /* a collection of Numerical Recipes functions, all related to distributions */
00002 /* Stefan Schaal, March 1993 */
00003 
00004 
00005 #include "math.h"
00006 #include "utility.h"
00007 
00008 #define ITMAX 100
00009 #define EPS   3.0e-7
00010 
00011 /* function */
00012 static double t_value_function(double *p);
00013 
00014 /*******************************************************************************/
00015 
00016 double my_betai(double a, double b, double x)
00017 
00018 {
00019         double bt;
00020         double my_gammln(), my_betacf();
00021         void my_nrerror();
00022         
00023         if (x < 0.0 || x > 1.0) {
00024                 printf("x = %f\n",x);
00025                 printf("BAD x in routine BETAI");
00026                 return MY_ERROR;
00027         }
00028         if (x == 0.0 || x == 1.0) bt = 0.0;
00029         else
00030                 bt = exp(my_gammln(a+b)-my_gammln(a)-my_gammln(b)+a*log(x)+b*log(1.0-x));
00031         if (x < (a+1.0)/(a+b+2.0))
00032                 return bt*my_betacf(a,b,x)/a;
00033         else 
00034                 return 1.0-bt*my_betacf(b,a,1.0-x)/b;
00035 }
00036 
00037 /*******************************************************************************/
00038 
00039 double my_betacf(double a, double b, double x)
00040 
00041 {
00042         double qap,qam,qab,em,tem,d;
00043         double bz,bm=1.0,bp,bpp;
00044         double az=1.0,am=1.0,ap,app,aold;
00045         int m;
00046         void my_nrerror();
00047 
00048         qab=a+b;
00049         qap=a+1.0;
00050         qam=a-1.0;
00051         bz=1.0-qab*x/qap;
00052         for (m=1;m<=ITMAX;m++) {
00053                 em=(double) m;
00054                 tem=em+em;
00055                 d=em*(b-em)*x/((qam+tem)*(a+tem));
00056                 ap=az+d*am;
00057                 bp=bz+d*bm;
00058                 d = -(a+em)*(qab+em)*x/((qap+tem)*(a+tem));
00059                 app=ap+d*az;
00060                 bpp=bp+d*bz;
00061                 aold=az;
00062                 am=ap/bpp;
00063                 bm=bp/bpp;
00064                 az=app/bpp;
00065                 bz=1.0;
00066                 if (fabs(az-aold) < (EPS*fabs(az))) return az;
00067         }
00068         my_nrerror("a or b too big, or ITMAX too small in BETACF");
00069 
00070         return 0.0;
00071 }
00072 
00073 /*******************************************************************************/
00074 
00075 double my_erf(double x)
00076 
00077 {
00078   double my_gammp();
00079 
00080   if (x > 26.0) {
00081     return 1.0;
00082   } else if (x < -26.0) {
00083     return 0.0;
00084   } else {
00085     return x < 0.0 ? -my_gammp(0.5,x*x) : my_gammp(0.5,x*x);
00086   }
00087 }
00088 
00089 /*******************************************************************************/
00090 
00091 double my_gammp(double a, double x)
00092 
00093 {
00094         double gamser,gammcf,gln;
00095         void my_gser(),my_gcf(),my_nrerror();
00096 
00097         if (x < 0.0 || a <= 0.0) my_nrerror("Invalid arguments in routine GAMMP");
00098         if (x < (a+1.0)) {
00099                 my_gser(&gamser,a,x,&gln);
00100                 return gamser;
00101         } else {
00102                 my_gcf(&gammcf,a,x,&gln);
00103                 return 1.0-gammcf;
00104         }
00105 }
00106 
00107 /*******************************************************************************/
00108 
00109 void my_gser(double *gamser, double a, double x, double *gln)
00110 
00111 {
00112         int n;
00113         double sum,del,ap;
00114         double my_gammln();
00115         void my_nrerror();
00116 
00117         *gln=my_gammln(a);
00118         if (x <= 0.0) {
00119                 if (x < 0.0) my_nrerror("x less than 0 in routine GSER");
00120                 *gamser=0.0;
00121                 return;
00122         } else {
00123                 ap=a;
00124                 sum=1.0/a;
00125                 del=sum;
00126                 for (n=1;n<=ITMAX;n++) {
00127                         ap += 1.0;
00128                         del *= x/ap;
00129                         sum += del;
00130                         if (fabs(del) < fabs(sum)*EPS) {
00131                                 *gamser=sum*exp(-x+a*log(x)-(*gln));
00132                                 return;
00133                         }
00134                 }
00135                 my_nrerror("a too large, ITMAX too small in routine GSER");
00136                 return;
00137         }
00138 }
00139 
00140 /*******************************************************************************/
00141 /* 
00142  * NOTE (adsouza):
00143  * This function is deprecated. Use gammaln_scalar() instead (see below) 
00144  */
00145 double my_gammln(double xx)
00146 
00147 {
00148         double x,tmp,ser;
00149         static double cof[6]={76.18009173,-86.50532033,24.01409822,
00150                 -1.231739516,0.120858003e-2,-0.536382e-5};
00151         int j;
00152 
00153         x=xx-1.0;
00154         tmp=x+5.5;
00155         tmp -= (x+0.5)*log(tmp);
00156         ser=1.0;
00157         for (j=0;j<=5;j++) {
00158                 x += 1.0;
00159                 ser += cof[j]/x;
00160         }
00161         return -tmp+log(2.50662827465*ser);
00162 }
00163 
00164 /*******************************************************************************/
00165 
00166 void my_gcf(double *gammcf, double a, double x, double *gln)
00167 
00168 {
00169         int n;
00170         double gold=0.0,g,fac=1.0,b1=1.0;
00171         double b0=0.0,anf,ana,an,a1,a0=1.0;
00172         double my_gammln();
00173         void my_nrerror();
00174 
00175         *gln=my_gammln(a);
00176         a1=x;
00177         for (n=1;n<=ITMAX;n++) {
00178                 an=(double) n;
00179                 ana=an-a;
00180                 a0=(a1+a0*ana)*fac;
00181                 b0=(b1+b0*ana)*fac;
00182                 anf=an*fac;
00183                 a1=x*a0+anf*a1;
00184                 b1=x*b0+anf*b1;
00185                 if (a1) {
00186                         fac=1.0/a1;
00187                         g=b1*fac;
00188                         if (fabs((g-gold)/g) < EPS) {
00189                                 *gammcf=exp(-x+a*log(x)-(*gln))*g;
00190                                 return;
00191                         }
00192                         gold=g;
00193                 }
00194         }
00195         my_nrerror("a too large, ITMAX too small in routine GCF");
00196 }
00197 
00198 /*******************************************************************************/
00199 
00200 double my_factln(int n)
00201 
00202 {
00203         static double a[101];
00204         double my_gammln();
00205         void my_nrerror();
00206 
00207         if (n < 0) my_nrerror("Negative factorial in routine FACTLN");
00208         if (n <= 1) return 0.0;
00209         if (n <= 100) return a[n] ? a[n] : (a[n]=my_gammln(n+1.0));
00210         else return my_gammln(n+1.0);
00211 }

00213 /*******************************************************************************/
00214 
00215 /* calculates the probability of a t value for a certain t(n) distribution */
00216 double prob_t(double t, double n)
00217 
00218 {
00219 
00220         double a, b, x;
00221         
00222         a = n / 2.0;
00223         b = 0.5;
00224         x = n/(n + sqr(t));
00225 
00226         return (1.0-my_betai(a,b,x));
00227 }
00228 
00229 /*******************************************************************************/
00230 
00231 /* calculates the probability of an F value for a certain F(m,n) distribution */
00232 double prob_f(double f, double m, double n)
00233 
00234 {
00235 
00236         double a, b, x;
00237         
00238         a = n / 2.0;
00239         b = m / 2.0;
00240         x = n / (n + m * f);
00241 
00242 /* printf("f=%f m=%f n=%f x=%f\n",f,m,n,x ); */
00243 
00244         return (my_betai(a,b,x));
00245 }
00246 
00247 
00248 /*******************************************************************************/
00249 
00250 double global_n;
00251 double global_alpha;
00252 
00253 /*  calculates the t value for a certain alpha and a certain number of
00254     degrees of freedom  */
00255 
00256 double t_value(double alph, double n) 
00257 
00258 {
00259   double    xn;
00260   double    fxn;
00261   double    dfdx;
00262 
00263 
00264 
00265   if ( n < 0.6) n = 0.6; /* avoid huge t values which are likely to
00266                             be numerically corrupted */
00267 
00268  
00269   /* since this function is well behaved, I find the point by the
00270      Newton-Raphson method */
00271 
00272   xn = .01;
00273   fxn = prob_t(xn,n)-alph;
00274   
00275   while(fabs(fxn) > .0001) {
00276 
00277     dfdx = (prob_t(xn+.01,n)-prob_t(xn-.01,n))/.02;
00278     xn = xn - fxn/dfdx;
00279     fxn = prob_t(xn,n)-alph;
00280 
00281   }
00282 
00283   return (xn);
00284 
00285 }
00286 
00287 /*!*****************************************************************************
00288  *******************************************************************************
00289  \note  digamma_scalar
00290  \date  July 07, 2002
00291  
00292  \remarks 
00293  
00294  Computes the digamma function for a scalar a.
00295  Digamma(a) = d/da log Gamma(a)
00296 
00297  Acknowledgements: Thanks to Matt Beal for the original matlab source
00298 
00299  *******************************************************************************
00300  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00301 
00302  \param[in]     a                : scalar a
00303  \param[out]    d                : result of the digamma function
00304 
00305  ******************************************************************************/
00306 int
00307 digamma_scalar(double a, double *d){
00308   static double coef[] = {-1./12, 1./120, -1./252, 1./240,
00309                           -1./132, 691./32760, -1./12};
00310   double tempx, z, logz;
00311   int y;
00312   int i,j,k,count;
00313 
00314   if(a<=0){
00315     fprintf(stderr, "Digamma of -ve number not allowed in >digamma_scalar<\n");
00316     return FALSE;
00317   }
00318 
00319   y = ceil(0>(6-a)?0:(6-a));
00320   z = a + y;
00321   logz = log(z);
00322   
00323   (*d) = logz - 0.5/z;
00324   for (k = 1; k <= 7; k++)
00325     (*d) += coef[k-1]*exp(-2*k*logz);
00326   for (k = 1; k <= 6; k++)
00327     if (y>=k) (*d) -= 1/(a+k-1);
00328   
00329   return TRUE;
00330 }
00331 
00332 /*!*****************************************************************************
00333  *******************************************************************************
00334  \note  digamma_vector
00335  \date  July 07, 2002
00336  
00337  \remarks 
00338  
00339  Computes the digamma function for a matrix a
00340  Digamma(a) = d/da log Gamma(a)
00341 
00342  Simply calls digamma_scalar() for each element of a
00343 
00344  *******************************************************************************
00345  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00346 
00347  \param[in]     a                : vector a
00348  \param[out]    d                : result of the digamma function
00349 
00350  ******************************************************************************/
00351 int
00352 digamma_vector(Vector a, Vector d){
00353   int i;
00354   int ar,dr;
00355   
00356   ar = a[NR];
00357   dr = d[NR];
00358 
00359   if(ar!=dr){
00360     fprintf(stderr, "Input/output vector size differ in >digamma_vector<\n");
00361     return FALSE;
00362   }
00363   
00364   for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
00365     digamma_scalar(a[i], &(d[i]));
00366   
00367   return TRUE;
00368 }
00369 
00370 /*!*****************************************************************************
00371  *******************************************************************************
00372  \note  digamma_matrix
00373  \date  July 07, 2002
00374  
00375  \remarks 
00376  
00377  Computes the digamma function for a matrix a
00378  Digamma(a) = d/da log Gamma(a)
00379 
00380  Simply calls digamma_scalar() for each element of a
00381 
00382  *******************************************************************************
00383  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00384 
00385  \param[in]     a                : matrix a
00386  \param[out]    d                : result of the digamma function
00387 
00388  ******************************************************************************/
00389 int
00390 digamma_matrix(Matrix a, Matrix d){
00391   int i,j;
00392   int ar,ac,dr,dc;
00393   int type;
00394   
00395   ar = a[0][NR];
00396   ac = a[0][NC];
00397   dr = d[0][NR];
00398   dc = d[0][NC];
00399 
00400   if(a[0][MAT_TYPE] < d[0][MAT_TYPE]){
00401     fprintf(stderr, "Incompatible size for destination matrix in >digamma_matrix<\n");
00402     return FALSE;
00403   }
00404 
00405   if(ar!=dr || ac!=dc){
00406     fprintf(stderr, "Input/output matrix size differ in >digamma_matrix<\n");
00407     return FALSE;
00408   }
00409 
00410   type = a[0][MAT_TYPE];
00411 
00412   switch(type){
00413   case IS_FULL:
00414     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
00415       for(j=1; j<=ac; j++)
00416         digamma_scalar(a[i][j], &(d[i][j]));
00417     break;
00418 
00419   case IS_SYMM:
00420     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
00421       for(j=i; j<=ac; j++)
00422         digamma_scalar(a[i][j], &(d[i][j]));
00423     if(d[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
00424       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
00425         for(j=i+1; j<=ac; j++)
00426           d[j][i] = d[i][j];
00427     break;
00428 
00429   case IS_DIAG:
00430     if(d[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_FULL)
00431       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
00432         for(j=1; j<ac; j++)
00433           d[i][j] = 0;
00434     if(d[0][MAT_TYPE]==IS_SYMM)
00435       for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
00436         for(j=i; j<ac; j++)
00437           d[i][j] = 0;
00438     for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
00439       digamma_scalar(a[i][i], &(d[i][i]));
00440     break;
00441 
00442   default:
00443     fprintf(stderr, "Unknown matrix type in >digamma_matrix<");
00444     exit(-12);
00445   }
00446 
00447   return TRUE;
00448 }
00449 
00450 /*!*****************************************************************************
00451  *******************************************************************************
00452  \note  gammaln_scalar
00453  \date  July 07, 2002
00454  
00455  \remarks 
00456  
00457  Computes the log Gamma function for a scalar a.
00458  gammaln(a) = log Gamma(a)
00459 
00460  Acknowledgements: Adapted from Numerical Recipes in C (pg. 214)
00461  
00462  Note: my_gammln() exists in distributions.c although it seems to be an
00463  older less accurate version. Ideally we should modify it to place a call
00464  to this function.
00465 
00466  *******************************************************************************
00467  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00468 
00469  \param[in]     a                : scalar a
00470  \param[out]    g                : result of the gammaln function
00471 
00472  ******************************************************************************/
00473 int
00474 gammaln_scalar(double a, double *g){
00475   static double coef[] = {76.18009172947146,-86.50532032941677,
00476                           24.01409824083091,-1.231739572450155,
00477                           0.1208650973866179e-2,-0.5395239384953e-5};
00478   double x,y,tmp,ser;
00479   int i;
00480   
00481   if(a<=0){
00482     fprintf(stderr, "gammaln of -ve number not allowed in >gammaln_scalar<\n");
00483     return FALSE;
00484   }
00485 
00486   y = x = a;
00487   tmp = x+5.5;
00488   tmp -= (x+0.5)*log(tmp);
00489   ser = 1.000000000190015;
00490   for(i=0; i<=5; i++)
00491     ser += coef[i]/++y;
00492 
00493   (*g) = -tmp+log(2.5066282746310005*ser/x);
00494   return TRUE;
00495 }
00496 
00497 /*!*****************************************************************************
00498  *******************************************************************************
00499  \note  gamma_entropy
00500  \date  July 07, 2002
00501  
00502  \remarks 
00503  
00504  Computes the entropy of a Gamma distribution with parameters a and b
00505  entropy = gammaln(a) - (a-1)*digamma(a) - log(b) + a;
00506 
00507  *******************************************************************************
00508  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00509 
00510  \param[in]     a                : +ve scalar a
00511  \param[in]     b                : +ve scalar b
00512  \param[out]    e                : entropy of Gamma(a,b)
00513 
00514  ******************************************************************************/
00515 int
00516 gamma_entropy(double a, double b, double *e){
00517   double tmp1,tmp2;
00518 
00519   if(a<=0 || b<=0){
00520     fprintf(stderr, "a, b should be > 0 in >gamma_entropy<");
00521     return FALSE;
00522   }
00523 
00524   gammaln_scalar(a,&tmp1);
00525   digamma_scalar(a,&tmp2);
00526 
00527   (*e) = tmp1 - (a-1)*tmp2 - log(b) + a;
00528   return TRUE;
00529 }
00530 
00531 /*!*****************************************************************************
00532  *******************************************************************************
00533  \note  dirichlet_entropy
00534  \date  July 08, 2002
00535  
00536  \remarks 
00537  
00538  Computes the entropy of a Dirichlet distribution with parameter vector a
00539 
00540  *******************************************************************************
00541  Parameters:  (i/o = input/output)
00542 
00543  \param[in]     a                : vector a
00544  \param[out]    e                : entropy of Dirichlet(a)
00545 
00546  ******************************************************************************/
00547 int
00548 dirichlet_entropy(Vector a, double* e){
00549   int i;
00550   int ar;
00551   double sum_a;
00552   double tmp;
00553 
00554   ar = a[NR];
00555 
00556   for(i=1; i<=ar; i++)
00557     if(a[i]<=0.0){
00558       fprintf(stderr, "All Dirichlet parameters should be +ve in >dirichlet_entropy<\n");
00559       return FALSE;
00560     }
00561   
00562   sum_a = 0.0;
00563   (*e) = 0.0;
00564   for(i=1; i<=ar; i++){
00565     sum_a += a[i];
00566     gammaln_scalar(a[i], &tmp);
00567     (*e) += tmp;
00568     digamma_scalar(a[i], &tmp);
00569     (*e) -= (a[i]-1)*tmp;
00570   }
00571   gammaln_scalar(sum_a, &tmp);
00572   (*e) -= tmp;
00573   digamma_scalar(sum_a, &tmp);
00574   (*e) += (sum_a-ar)*tmp;
00575   
00576   return TRUE;
00577 }
